column4: I'm running into a small problem getting the correct codecs installed for my 8.10 install. I have only loaded the two gstreamer plugins that were suggested when I tried to play an mp3, but then again ...I did run all those updates that ubuntu wanted run when I got it up and running, so that is the problem. When I tried to install "Ubuntu restricted extras" it gave me an error that said I had a conflict.
how did you install the first codecs and from where
I tried to play a mp3 and it suggested the 2 gstreamers and I installed them and the mp3 played just fine
please paste.ubuntu.com with the command and errors you are getting to install the extras package
but when I first got ubuntu up it wanted to install a bunch of updates 216 to be precise
the errors on on another machine, so I will have to type it out by hand
could you summarize then
then best remove them via synaptic and try again
synaptic will give more info
I have it open now what?
mark ubuntu-restricted-extras for installation and apply
ah HA
Thats just WAY too simple BLUSH
you fixed it?
I think I'm well on teh way ...it will take a little bit for everything to finish

helping others can be a very satisfying feeling. I'm a mod at another irc spot that has nothing to do with Ubuntu, but it is a very good feeling when I know I've helped people, but the thing that always feels good is when someone says Thank You. and so now I'll say Thanks to you!
glad you fixed it
I'm not so sure I'm done just yet ..I tried to open the dvd and it started to play, but hung up on the FBI screen ...I'm assuming that I still need more in the way of codecs?
libdvdcss2 from medibuntu.org (just the package not the repo)
Oops I reread that again ...I'll sail over to medibuntu
my computer appears to have hung ...remember that I have 2 pcs, the one I'm on here and the ubuntu pc
I'm not sure if I stayed muted after my accidental flood or not, but I'm trying to fix my ICEauthority problem.
